articles.title: Sri Lanka: Ranil Wickremesinghe elected president
articles.description: Ranil Wickremesinghe is allied with the former leaders and so deeply unpopular with the Sri Lankan public.
articles.content:
By Frances Mao in Singapore & Anbarasan Ethirajan in Colombo, Sri LankaBBC News
Sri Lankan MPs have elected prime minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as the country's new president, despite his unpopu… [+5068 chars]

articles.title: Covid cases are skyrocketing again. States have no new plans.
articles.description: Strategies for managing 130,000 new daily Covid cases are largely the same as they were for managing 30,000 new daily cases four months ago.
articles.content: When youve said the same thing over and over about being vaccinated, being boosted, that if youre vulnerable and youre indoors with people who are not part of your household and you cant distance, yo… [+9438 chars]

articles.title: U.S. House passes bill protecting marriage equality
articles.description: The U.S. House of Representatives on Tuesday passed a bill protecting gay marriage rights, after the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade imperiled similar precedents that protected rights to same-sex relations and contraception.
articles.content: WASHINGTON, July 19 (Reuters) - The U.S. House of Representatives on Tuesday passed a bill protecting gay marriage rights, after the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade imperiled similar… [+2547 chars]

articles.author: Celina Tebor, USA TODAY
articles.title: How aggressive border control tactics in Texas contributed to inaction during Uvalde shooting
articles.description: The Uvalde report said the community was accustomed to security alerts. Experts say aggressive border control policies contributed to that.
articles.content:
Robb Elementary students were used to lockdowns. From February to May, the school in Uvalde, Texas, had been secured or locked down 47 times. 
When a lockdown alert came May 24 – the day an 18-year-… [+5564 chars]
